snippet: The advertising company, criticized for its compensation practices for senior executives, said it would take the nonbinding vote seriously.
abstract: Majority of WPP shareholders vote against the company's 2011 remuneration report and chief executive Martin Sorrell's 6.8 million pounds ($10.5 million) pay package; vote increases pressure on WPP to rethink its pay practices for senior executives.
lead_paragraph: The advertising company, criticized for its compensation practices for senior executives, said it would take the nonbinding vote seriously.

headline.seo: Shareholders Reject WPP Chief’s Pay Package
headline.main: WPP Chief’s Pay Package Is Rejected by Shareholders
headline.print_headline: WPP Chief’s Pay Package Is Rejected by Shareholders
